definitions: A model of intentional change that focuses on the decision-making of the individual.
A comprehensive theory of change that integrates processes and principles of change from across major theories of intervention.
A model used in health promotion to understand and facilitate behavior change, often referred to as the Stages of Change Model.
examples: Researchers applied The Transtheoretical Model to study smoking cessation.
Understanding the stages of The Transtheoretical Model is crucial for effective intervention.
The Transtheoretical Model provides a framework for tailoring health messages.
